comment.author: 30300990@N04
comment._content: His clothing style is something one would associate with a gunslinger.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Pascual Orozco Merino (or Sr.) born in the western mountains of Chihuahua State, in 1859.
He was Pascual Orozco Vásquez's  (or Jr.) (the main chieftain of Madero´s rebelion in Chihuahua) father.  Was executed shot to death by Zapata in April 1913 in Morelos State.
Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you Dr. Duarte for pointing out that this man is most likely Pascual Orozco's father.  We'll make the change the next time we update this record.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: See Pascual Orozco Jr. picture in www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2868000539/ and www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4350858909/

comment.author: 74482999@N03
comment._content: This man is definitely Pascual Sr.  His pseudo trial and subsequent execution almost changed the face of the revolution.  Pascual Jr.  requested Huerta to place him in command of the forces to finish off Zapata.  Huerta refused.  Pascual Sr was killed about two and half years prior to his famous son.   - Phil Stover
